intro: Salacicratea papuana, commonly known as the Papuan salacine, is a flowering plant native to the lowland rainforests of Papua, Indonesia. It belongs to the Salicaceae family, which includes willows and poplars, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. It is often found growing near streams or in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
